pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.24: _Uttarattharaṇa_. Sp.1.517: _Uttarattharaṇanti mañcakassa upari attharaṇakaṃ vuccati_, “What is spread on top of a bed is called an _uttarattharaṇa_.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:2.30: _Cīvara_ means both a finished robe and any cloth that can be used to make a robe. Thus I vary my translation depending on the context.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np6:3.1.13: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see [](MS.3.1595). | This means not smaller than 8 by 4 standard (_sugata_) finger-breadths, or 16 by 8 cm; see [](Kkh.) and BMC I, pp.565-566.
